SEARCH
Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.control.base

Class AbstractAddableView

java.lang.Object
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.control.base.AbstractView
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.control.base.AbstractAddableView
Direct Known Subclasses:
CategoriesView, DeadlinesView, TransactionsView
public abstract class AbstractAddableView extends AbstractView
This class are kind of a base thing for views that show an action column with button in a TableView. It mostly just wire the column so each row have a small button and when user click it, something happen (the provided callback runned). Not fancy, a bit rough around edges, but do the job okay-ish.

Column is set to not sortable and also not re-orderable; when peoples move it around the behaviour goes wierd and users gets confuse and start ask “why is broken??”, so better no.

Usage (kinda)


 TableColumn<MyRow, MyRow> actionCol = new TableColumn<>("Actions");
 wireActionColumn(
     actionCol,
     "Delete",
     row -> deleteRow(row),
     this::confirmDeletion,
     this::refreshAfterDeletion
 );

Threading: please call it on JavaFX Application Thread, otherwise click events arrive late or not arrive and UI start behave bad, you dont want that trust me.

  • Method Details

    • wireActionColumn

      protected <R> void wireActionColumn(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<R,R> col, String label, Consumer<R> onAction, Supplier<Boolean> confirm, Runnable after)
      Wire the action column so every cell show a button with the given label and behaviour. The cell value factory expose the whole row item (so the action have all context it need), and the cell factory create a tiny button that do the action when pressed. Sorting/reordering is disabled because it not make sense here and can break expected flows, like, really.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the row item type; must match your table generic or else it compiles but works bad later
      Parameters:
      col - the column to wire (usually TableColumn<R,R>); other combos are possible but gives trouble
      label - text on the button; if null/empty user think feature is dead, so please give some label
      onAction - callback called when user click; it receives the row value and should do stuff fast (not block ui)
      confirm - supplier asked before doing; if it return true we go, if false we dont. Some impl maybe accept null but that is kinda risky and surprising later on.
      after - hook runned after finish; can refresh table or do nothing, depends what you need now
